{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine whether successful completion of the Perinatal Education Programme (PEP) improves obstetric practice, we can look at the relevant documents that discuss the impact of the program on obstetric practice. Document [1] specifically addresses this question. It conducted a 'before-and-after' study design to assess any changes in practice after the implementation of the PEP. The study found that completion of the obstetric manual of the PEP improved the knowledge of the midwives, but no alteration in practice was detected. Therefore, based on the available evidence, the answer is B. no.", "answer_choice": "B"}
